title: To Duo or not to Duo
body:
Hey guys.

Saw a few post stating duo made it harder to climb.

What`s your thoughts ?

replies.body:
I have a Duo of the same Elo. Im not trying to cheat.. 

Can someone explain why its harder ?

Because of the system expecting you to do better as you have communication they match you against harder opponents.

For example if you and another bronze 4 duo'd you'd likely have the enemy team be bronze 3's (or also have a duo)

Generally what it ends up doing instead is mismatching the lanes against you and you will tend to find more feeders (when really it's the duo's fault)

Not just harder opponents. but people in the team with the duo will be of a lower mmr in order to balance things out. Basically, you would be placed against slightly higher opponents and made to play with lesser skilled players in your team

Your MMR is considered higher for the purpose of matchmaking if you are in a duo queue.
This means:
-higher-rated opponents (who will perform better than usual)
-higher-rated teammates (who expect you to perform better than usual) <- not all the time*
-lower MMR gains for wins (as you are counted higher than what you are)
-greater MMR losses for losses (as you are counted higher than what you are)

'course, if you have good synergy and some means of having voice comm, go for it. Just know it's not gonna be a straight up advantage.

*example:
let's say your MMR and your duo friend's are, arbitrarily, 10, and being duo counts as a +2.
All numbers are made up and rounded for clarity (whoooo, i feel like a ritoer now! CLARITY!)

case 1:
your team: you and the duo (10&10, counted as 12&12), three randoms (a 10, a 14 and a 12)= average 12. enemy team are 10, 12, 12, 14, 13, 11, with an equal average of 12. You have better players in both teams, but you are way over your head.

case 2:
your team: 10&10 (12&12), 10, 11, 10. average 11 (actually 10). enemy team: 8, 13, 11, 12, 10. average 11. While you count as the best players in your team due to being duo, the "best player" in your team is barely the average level of the enemy team.

We are S5 and B3 so reasonably close.. 

The point you make about one of us normally ending up as ADC or sup makes a good point.

it's dependent on you and your duo...

are you both average players in the same mmr? get away from each other
are you both for example, silver 5 but both consistently do well and belong for example, silver 3-2? duoing in that scenario can be very good...
but you need your roles to connect... in general if you duo one of you will be first pick, the other 4th or 5th pick. 
you can expect your duo partner to be forced support/adc so having a duo which is decent in those roles + another role is quite important.... 

so if I as silver 3 but felt a lot better than my current elo I would find someone of similar skill whose roles connected with mine, but they would also have to be decent at support/ADC in case they were forced into these roles...

duoing is also good if you have a gold/plat/diamond/challenjour friend who's on a silver 5 account... basically free wins every time... (provided you are close in divisions, silver 4 him, silver 5 you)

It will match you with slightly better opponents and/or worse teammates so you need to make sure the advantage you gain from duoing is enough to offset this.

It's probably also unlikely that you and your duo will keep improving at the same rate so one of you might start holding the other back eventually.
it does make it harder to climb LEGITIMATELY but its ez to climb if you get carried lol
